([[Chief Executive Officer|CEO]] & [[Managing Director|MD]]) | industry = [[IT service management|IT services]], [[Information technology consulting|IT consulting]] | services = IT, [[business consulting]] and [[outsourcing]] services | revenue = {{profit}} [[United States dollar|US$]] 6.041 billion (2011){{cite web|url=http://www.google.com/finance?q=NASDAQ:INFY&fstype=ii|title=2010 Form 10-K, Infosys Technologies Limited |publisher=Infosys Invester}} | net_income = {{profit}} US$ 1.499 billion (2011) | assets = {{profit}} US$ 7.010 billion (2011) | operating_income = {{profit}} US$ 1.779 billion (2011) | equity = {{profit}} US$ 6.122 billion (2011) | owner = | num_employees = 133,560 (2011) | parent = | divisions = [[Infosys BPO]], [[Infosys China]] | subsid = | homepage = {{URL|www.infosys.com}} | footnotes = | intl = yes }} '''Infosys Limited''', formerly '''Infosys Technologies Limited''' ({{BSE|500209}}, {{NSE|INFY}}, {{NASDAQ|INFY}}) is a global technology services company headquartered in [[Bangalore]], [[India]]. It is the second largest IT exporter in India with 133,560 employees as of March 2011. It has offices in 33 countries and development centers in India, China, Australia, UK, Canada, Brazil and Japan.{{cite web|author=Infosys Technologies Limited |url=http://www.infosys.com/about/who-we-are/Pages/fact-file.aspx |title=Fact File | Who We Are | About Us |publisher=Infosys |accessdate=27 July 2010}} Infosys provides business consulting, technology, engineering and outsourcing services to help clients in over 30 countries. The company also provides software products to the banking industry. Through Infosys business process outsourcing (BPO), it provides business process management services, such as offsite customer relationship management, finance and accounting, and administration and sales order processing. ==History== Infosys was founded on 2 July 1981 by seven entrepreneurs: [[N. R. Narayana Murthy]], [[Nandan Nilekani]], [[Kris Gopalakrishnan]], [[S. D. Shibulal]], [[K. Dinesh]],[[Ashok Arora]], and with [[N. S. Raghavan]] officially being the first employee of the company. The founders started the company with an initial investment of [[Indian Rupee|INR]] 10,000.{{cite web|author=Narayana Murthy |url=http://www.moneycontrol.com/news/management/learn-entrepreneurshipinfosys-way_341544.html |title=Learn entrepreneurship the Infosys way! â CNBC-TV18/TiE-Leaders and Learners |publisher=Moneycontrol.com |accessdate=27 July 2010}} The company was incorporated as "Infosys Consultants Pvt Ltd." in Model Colony, [[Pune]] as the registered office.{{cite web|url=http://www.rediff.com/computer/1999/jan/11infosy.htm |title=Rediff On The Net, Infotech: Infosys begins work on Rs 1.35-billion Pune centre |publisher=Rediff.com |date=11 January 1999 [[File:Bangalore Infy.jpg|left|thumb|Infosys headquarters in [[Bengaluru]], India]] According to ''Forbes'' magazine, since its 1993 public listing on the [[Bombay Stock Exchange]] until the year 2000, Infosys' sales and earnings compounded at more than 70% a year.{{cite web|url=http://www.forbes.com/forbes/2000/1030/6612080a.html|title=Passage to India|work=Forbes|accessdate=12 April 2009|date=30 October 2000}} In the year 2000, US President [[Bill Clinton]] complimented India on its achievements in high technology, citing the example of Infosys along with Wipro and Satyam Computers.{{cite web|url=http://www.expressindia.com/news/fe/daily/20000325/fco25053.html|title=Clinton calls for closer ties to boost IT business|publisher=Indian Express|accessdate=12 April 2009|date=25 March 2000}} Infosys will invest $100 million (Rs 440 crore) on establishing a 20,000-seater campus in Shanghai.{{cite web|title= Infy plans Rs 440-cr China campus |url= http://business.rediff.com/report/2010/oct/22/tech-infy-plans-rs-440-cr-china-campus.htm |publisher=business.rediff.com|accessdate=25 Oct 2010}} In 2001, it was rated the by [[Business Today]].{{cite web | author=R. Sukumar | title = India's Best Employers: The Top 5 | work=A BT-Hewitt study | publisher=Business Today | url = http://www.india-today.com/btoday/20010121/cover2.html | accessdate =10 October 2006 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20060701051112/http://www.india-today.com/btoday/20010121/cover2.html |archivedate = 1 July 2006}} Infosys was rated best employer to work for in 2000, 2001, and 2002 by Hewitt Associates. In 2007, Infosys received over 1.3 million applications and hired fewer than 3% of applicants.{{cite web|url=http://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1067491/000106749107000015/form20f.htm#item6 |title=INFY 2007 20-F, Item 6 |publisher=Sec.gov |accessdate=7 September 2010}} Infosys was the only Indian company to win the Global MAKE (Most Admired Knowledge Enterprises) award for the years 2003, 2004 and 2005, and is inducted into the Global Hall of Fame for the same.{{cite web | title = Infosys recognized as a Globally Most Admired Knowledge Enterprise for 2004 | work=A Teleos study | publisher=Infosys Media | url = http://www.infosys.com/newsroom/press-releases/Documents/2004/MAKEGLOBAL-PressRelease-25Nov04.pdf | format = PDF | accessdate =1 December 2004 }}{{cite web | title = Infosys in the Global Hall of Fame | url = http://www.infosys.com/media/press_releases/global-make-award-hall-of-fame.asp}}{{dead link|date=November 2011}} Infosys was also ranked as the 15th most trusted brand in India by [[The Brand Trust Report]] in 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindubusinessline.com/features/brandline/article2029427.ece |title=Components of trust that brands can focus on |publisher=thehindubusinessline.com |date=2011-05-18}} The first development center outside Bangalore was setup in the coastal city of Mangalore in the year 1995. == Current share holding == [[Life Insurance Corporation of India]] with 3.84% is the single largest shareholder. [[Abu Dhabi Investment Authority]], a sovereign wealth fund owned by Abu Dhabi, and the [[Government of Singapore]] also hold significant shareholdings. The remaining public shares are owned by financial institutions and individual investors.http://www.infosys.com/investors/reports-filings/quarterly-results/Documents/Share-Holding/clause35-june30-2010.pdf == Initiatives == [[File:Mysore India Infosys .JPG|thumb|250px|Infosys has the largest corporate university in the world, located on its [[Mysore]] campus.{{cite web|author=Infosys Technologies Limited |url=http://www.infosys.com/beyond-business/pages/index.aspx |title=Sustainability |publisher=Infosys |accessdate=27 July 2010}}{{dead link|date=November 2011}}]] In 1996, Infosys created the [[Infosys Foundation]], operating in the areas of health care, social rehabilitation and rural uplift, education, arts and culture. Since then, this [[foundation (charity)|foundation]] has spread its activities from its headquarters in [[Karnataka]] to the Indian states of [[Tamil Nadu]], [[Andhra Pradesh]], [[Maharashtra]], [[Kerala]], [[Orissa]] and [[Punjab, India|Punjab]]. The Infosys Foundation is chaired by the wife of company founder [[Narayana Murthy]], Mrs. [[Sudha Murthy]]. Since 2004, Infosys has embarked on a series of initiatives to consolidate and formalise its academic relationships worldwide under the umbrella of a program called AcE â Academic Entente.{{cite web|author=Infosys Technologies Limited |url=http://www.infosys.com/InStepWeb/about-internship/global-academic-program.asp |title=InStep | About Internship | Global Academic Program |publisher=Infosys |accessdate=27 July 2010}}{{dead link|date=November 2011}} Infosys' Global Internship Program, known as InStep, is one of the key components of the Academic Entente initiative. It offers live projects to interns from universities around the world. InStep recruits undergraduate and graduate students from business, technology, and liberal arts universities to take part in an 8 to 24 week internship at one of Infosys' global offices. InStep interns are also provided career opportunities with Infosys. In 1997, Infosys started the "Catch them Young Program", to expose urban youth to information technology by conducting a summer vacation program. The program is aimed at developing an interest and understanding of [[computer science]] and information technology. This program is targeted at students in Grade IX level.{{cite web | publisher=The Hindu | title = Summer fun | date = 14 June 2004 | url = http://www.hindu.com/yw/2004/08/14/stories/2004081400640200.htm | accessdate =12 October 2006}} In 2002, the [[Wharton Business School]] of the [[University of Pennsylvania]] and Infosys started the Wharton Infosys Business Transformation Award. This technology award recognises enterprises and individuals who have transformed their businesses and the society leveraging information technology. Past winners include [[Samsung]], [[Amazon.com]], [[Capital One]], [[Royal Bank of Scotland|RBS]] and [[ING Direct]]. Infosys houses the largest corporate education center in the world in [[Mysore, India|Mysore]]. The facility can accommodate 14,000 candidates at one time.{{cite web|author=Infosys Technologies Limited |url=http://www.infosys.com/newsroom/press-releases/Pages/global-education-center-II.aspx |title=Sonia Gandhi Inaugurates Global Education Center in Mysore | Press Releases | Newsroom |publisher=Infosys |accessdate=27 July 2010}} In 2009, Infosys created ''Infosys Prize'' for excellence in physical and mathematical sciences, engineering and computer science, life sciences and social sciences.{{cite web|url=http://www.infosys-science-foundation.com/about_prize.html |title=Infosys Prize â About |publisher=Infosys-science-foundation.com |accessdate=27 July 2010}} Infosys developed a corporate [[Research and development|R&D]] wing called Software Engineering and Technology Labs (SETLabs). SETLabs was founded in 2000 to carry out applied research for the development of processes, frameworks and methodologies to effectively capture customer requirements and to iron out common critical issues during a project life cycle.{{cite web|url=http://www.technologyreview.com/Infotech/21161/?a=f |title=Tracking a Shopper's Habits |publisher=Technology Review |accessdate=27 July 2010}} Various broad groups are Software Engg Lab, Convergence Lab, Innovation Lab, Center for KDIS, Security and Privacy Lab and Distributed Computing Laboratory. ==Charity== In 2005, Infosys donated {{INR}}10 million (about $226,000) to help with the effects of the [[2005 Kashmir earthquake]] in Pakistan.{{cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/south_asia/4334530.stm |title=South Asia | Indian
